main event: A civilian reported sighting a round, flat object resembling a cover of a garbage can or a barrel top, moving at a high speed and leaving a yellowish, tapering trail in the sky in Morgantown, West Virginia.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 18 inches in diameter at an altitude of 15,000 feet and shone with intense cold luminescence resembling the color of the moon.
The object traveled from Northeast to Southwest, was in sight for 2-3 seconds, and sounded like a sky rocket or a turbine engine.
A persistent dark red trail was observed on a separate sighting, similar to the previous sighting, with no effect on the clouds or weather.
The witness, a real estate business owner who enjoys outdoor sports and astronomy, refrained from reporting the sighting for a week due to fears of ridicule.
The witness reported several similar sightings prior to the documented ones.
sighted object: round, flat object resembling a cover of a garbage can or a barrel top
